summary: The Shandra Eisenga Human Cell and Tissue Product Safety Act mandates a public awareness campaign on human cell and tissue product transplants, focusing on risks, benefits, and donation. It defines key terms, amends the Public Health Service Act to impose civil penalties for violations of regulations on human cell and tissue products, and streamlines regulatory oversight. The bill directs the Secretary of Health and Human Services to publish information on the FDA website regarding the Tissue Reference Group, establishes a public docket for comments, and requires a report to Congress with recommendations for regulation modernization.
